questions.text: A 56-year-old postmenopausal woman comes to the physician because of a 6-month history of worsening pain and swelling in her left knee. She has a history of peptic ulcer disease for which she takes cimetidine. Examination shows palpable crepitus and limited range of motion of the left knee. Which of the following is the most appropriate pharmacotherapy for this patient’s symptoms?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Celecoxib Celecoxib is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It works by reducing hormones that cause inflammation and pain in the body. Celecoxib is used to treat pain or inflammation caused by many conditions such as arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, and menstrual pain.

Highyeild:

Celecoxib is a selective NSAID and COX-2 inhibitor, which can be used to treat acute pain (equally in rheumatic arthritis and non-rheumatoid joint pain). Compared to nonselective NSAIDs, COX-2 inhibitors have reduced gastrointestinal toxicity, but nonetheless carry a minimal risk of gastrointestinal side effects. Therefore, close supervision of this patient is recommended due to a residual risk for gastrointestinal bleeding (especially in PUD). Unlike nonselective NSAIDs, selective COX-2 inhibitors do not have an effect on platelet aggregation, since platelets only possess COX-1.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: B. Acetylsalicylic acid , Aspirin’s chemical name is 2-Acetoxybenzoic acid. Aspirin, a chemical called acetylsalicylic acid (ASA), is widely used worldwide as an anti-inflammatory and antipyretic drug. Formula and structure: the molecular formula for acetylsalicylic acid Option: A. ketorolac is used for short-term management of moderate to severe pain. It is usually not prescribed for longer than five days. Ketorolac is effective when administered with paracetamol to control pain in neonates because it does not depress respiration as opioids. Ketorolac is also an adjuvant to opioid medications and improves pain relief. Option: C. Ibuprofen is a medication in the nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) class that is used for treating pain, fever, and inflammation. This includes painful menstrual periods, migraines, and rheumatoid arthritis. It may also be used to close a patent ductus arteriosus in a premature baby.

questions.text: Among the following options, Lasmiditan belongs to which class?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

5HT 1 F Agonist Lasmiditan Lasmiditan is used to treat the symptoms of migraine headaches (severe throbbing headaches that sometimes are accompanied by nausea and sensitivity to sound and light). Lasmiditan is in a class of medications called selective serotonin receptor agonists. Serotonin 1F agonist is Lasmiditan and is used for the acute treatment of migraine, with or without aura, in adults, agonist at 5HT 1 F receptor & inhibits descending pain pathway Toxicity: dizziness, vertigo

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A- 5HT 2A/2C antagonist- Clozapine atypical antipsychotic is a 5-HT2A/2C blocker Option: B - 5HT1B/1D Agonist is triptans (Sumatriptan) Option: C- 5HT2C partial agonist is Aripiprazole, used in schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.

questions.text: Among the following options, which drug belongs to PG F2 alpha?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Dinoprost PG F2 Alpha (Natural Prostaglandin), Dinoprost is a medicine used to induce labour in women, who are ready to deliver a full-term baby. It works by softening and widening the cervix (lower end of the uterus) and helps the baby to pass through easily.

Highyeild:

Dinoprostone (prostin E2) Vaginal pessary/gel Clinical use: IOL - 3mg 6hrs apart (no more than 2 pessaries in 24hrs and max. 3 doses) Side effect: Nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea, fever, Uterine hyperstimulation, HTN, bronchospasm Advantages: - Mobile patient -Reduce need for syntocinon

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A - Misoprostol : PG E1- Methyl PGE1 ester, Prostaglandin analogue, Misoprostol is a synthetic prostaglandin medication used to prevent and treat stomach and duodenal ulcers, induce labour, cause an abortion, and treat postpartum bleeding due to poor contraction of the uterus. It is taken by mouth when used to prevent gastric ulcers in people taking NSAIDs. Option: B - Alprostadil : PG E1 ( Natural prostaglandin ), Alprostadil is used to treat erectile dysfunction (inability to maintain an erection for intercourse) in men. It relaxes the blood vessels in the penis, thereby increasing blood flow during sexual stimulation. This helps to achieve and maintain a hard, erect penis suitable for sexual activity Option: C- Dinoprostone: PG E2 Natural Prostaglandin, (PGE2 ) is a naturally-occurring biomolecule. It is found in low concentrations in most tissues of the body and functions as a local hormone (1-3). As with any local hormone, it is very rapidly metabolized in the tissues of synthesis (the half-life estimated to be 2.5-5 minutes).

questions.text: Among the following options, which prostaglandin is given by inhalational route?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Treprostinil May be administered by subcutaneous/intravenous infusion or by inhalation or also by oral, Treprostinil and Iloprost is given as an inhalation in pulmonary HTN, Treprostinil, is a vasodilator that is used for the treatment of pulmonary arterial hypertension. Treprostinil is a synthetic analogue of prostacyclin (PGI 2 ).

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A- Epoprostenol- Primary pulmonary hypertension has been successfully maintained on epoprostenol infused continuously in a large vein. It is not given by inhalation route. Option: C- Misoprostol is a PGE1 analogue used in Medical termination of pregnancy with antiprogestin (Mifepristone), NSAIDs induced Peptic ulcer but the drug of choice is PPI. Option: D- To maintain patency of ductus arteriosus in neonates with congenital heart defects, till corrective surgery is undertaken. PGE1 (Alprostadil) is used

questions.text: Drug used to maintain patency of ductus arteriosus is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Alprostadil PGE1 (Alprostadil) used: To maintain patency of ductus arteriosus in neonates with congenital heart defects, till surgery is undertaken, used in erectile dysfunction

Highyeild:

Alpostin Injections Side Effects The most common side effects of Alprostadil (Alpostin Injections) are penile pain, erection lasting 4 to 6 hours (prolonged erection), penile fibrosis (deformed penis shape), bruising at the injection site, penile numbness, irritation, sensitivity, itching, swelling and discoloration, skin tears of the penis and penile rash.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: B- Latanoprost- Topical PGF2α that are FP receptor agonists are the first choice drugs in wide-angle glaucoma Option: C- Misoprostol is a PGE1 analogue used in Medical termination of pregnancy with antiprogestin (Mifepristone), NSAIDs induced Peptic ulcer but the drug of choice is PPI. Option: D - Epoprostenol- Primary pulmonary hypertension has been successfully maintained on epoprostenol infused continuously in a large vein. It is not given by inhalation route

questions.text: All are used for post-partum haemorrhage except?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Dinoprostone Dinoprostone gel intravaginally can be used for cervical ripening and induction of labour (not for PPH)

Highyeild:

Oxytocin is 1st line agent for the management of PPH. It acts via rhythmic stimulation of the upper segment of the myometrium, which constricts spiral arteries. 10 international units (IU) should be injected intramuscularly, or 20 IU in 1 L of saline may be infused at a rate of 250 mL per hour. Ergot alkaloids like methergine and ergometrine cause generalized contraction of both upper and lower segments of the uterus tetanically. Misoprostol, a synthetic prostaglandin El, decreases postpartum bleeding by increasing uterine tone. It can be administered sublingually, orally, vaginally, and rectally. Carboprost (synthetic PGF2a) acts by enhancing uterine contractility and causing vasoconstriction. It can be administered intramuscularly at a dose of 250 mcg and can be repeated at 15-90 min intervals (maximum total dose 2mg or 8 doses) Dinoprostone gel intravaginally can be used for cervical ripening and induction of labour (not for PPH)

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A- Uterotonic agents including oxytocin, ergot alkaloids and prostaglandins. Option: D-Oxytocin is a peptide hormone and neuropeptide normally produced in the hypothalamu s and released by the posterior pituitary. It plays a role in social bonding, reproduction, childbirth, and the period after childbirth. Oxytocin is released into the bloodstream as a hormone in response to sexual activity Option: C- Prostaglandin F2α (PGF2α in prostanoid nomenclature), pharmaceutically termed carboprost is a naturally occurring prostaglandin used in medicine to induce labour and as an abortifacient. Prostaglandins are lipids throughout the entire body that have a hormone-like function.

questions.text: All the following are true about aspirin except:

options.label: B
options.text: Can be used in children with viral fever

questions.correct_answer: B. Can be used in children with viral fever
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Can be used in children with viral fever

Highyeild:

Aspirin: Irreversibly inhibits COX Enzymes not used in children < 12 years due to the risk of Reye’s syndrome useful in transient ischemic attacks due to antiplatelet property enteric coated tablets can be to be used in patients with duodenal ulcers

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A- Aspirin is the only NSAID which is an Irreversible inhibitor of the COX enzyme, others are reversible inhibitors. Option: C- Aspirin By inhibiting platelet aggregation lowers the incidence of reinfarction. Option: D- Prevention of colon cancer: incidence of colon cancer among regular aspirin users is much lower

Table:

DRUG INDICATION PARACETAMOL Relieves mild to moderate pain from muscle aches, headaches, colds, sore throats, backaches, arthritis, toothaches, and menstrual periods. Also helps reduce fever. NSAIDS (Aspirin) Used to treat mild to moderate pain Also helps reduce fever NSAIDS (Ibuprofen) Relieves mild to moderate pain; relieves pain due to arthritis. menstrual cramps, cold and fever, muscles aches, toothaches, backaches, and headaches. Also helps to reduce fever NSAIDS (Mefenamic acid) Used for patients > 12 years old Mild to moderate pain. People take them to treat pain due to arthritis, menstrual cramps, cold and fever, muscles aches, toothaches, backaches, and headaches. Propyphenazone combination (with paracetamol and caffeine) Relief of mild to severe headache, fever, toothache, neuralgia, dysmenorrhea, fatigue due to common colds & other viral infections

questions.text: The effect of aspirin on urate excretion, if it is taken > 5 g/day is?

options.label: A
options.text: Urate retention and antagonism of all other uricosuric drugs

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Increased urate excretion The effect of low-dose aspirin to inhibit urate excretion may result from aspirin-induced inhibition of urate secretion by the proximal tubule. Paradoxically, much larger doses of aspirin (>3 gm/day; or over ten 325 mg tablets/day) have been observed to be uricosuric (increase urate elimination in the urine)

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Effect of aspirin on urate excretion: Option: A- < 2 g/day—urate retention and antagonism of all other uricosuric drugs. Option: C- 2–5 g/day—variable effects, often no change > 5 g/day—increased urate excretion.

questions.text: Which of the following stabilizes lysosomes and inhibits LOX?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ketoprofen An additional action to stabilize lysosomes and to inhibit LOX has been demonstrated with ketoprofen; though anti-inflammatory efficacy is similar to ibuprofen, and side effects are more Ketoprofen: NSAID Propionic acid derivative has additional action to stabilize lysosomes and inhibit LOX has been demonstrated

Highyeild:

NSAIDS ■ Side-effects ■ GI ■ Renal: reduce GFR ■ Increase fluid retention, HTN ■ Increase fluid retention, HTN ■ Platelet dysfunction ■ Alternative treatments ■ Consider nonacetylated salicylates or COX-2 selective (Diclofenac, Meloxicam), celecoxib plus PPi ■ Consider topical therapy (Capsasin) ■ Consider Naproxen or Tylenol or topical therapy ■ Consider non-pharmacologic therapy ■ Consider Acetaminophen

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. Diclofenac is used to treat the symptoms of rheumatoid arthritis and is being studied in the prevention and treatment of some types of skin cancer. Option: B. Naproxen is NSAID, it reduces swelling (inflammation) and pain in joints and muscles. Option: D. It is an NSAID used to treat pain and help relieve symptoms of arthritis (osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis). Such as inflammation, swelling stiffness and joint pain

questions.text: Aspirin should be used with caution in the following groups of patients because of which of the following reason?

options.label: A
options.text: In diabetics because it can cause hyperglycemia

options.label: B
options.text: In children with viral disease, because of the risk of acute renal failure

options.label: C
options.text: In gout, because it can increase serum uric acid

options.label: D
options.text: In pregnancy, because of the high risk of teratogenicity

questions.correct_answer: C. In gout, because it can increase serum uric acid
questions.explanation:
Solution:

In gout, because it can increase serum uric acid At therapeutic doses, Aspirin can cause hyperuricemia by decreasing the excretion of uric acid. It, therefore, should not be used in patients with gout. It also decreases the uricosuric action of probenecid. At high doses (>5 g/d), it increases the excretion of uric acid, but such high doses are not tolerated.

Highyeild:

MOA: Gout Drugs

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A- It should be avoided in diabetics because of the risk of hypoglycemia Option: B- Aspirin is contraindicated in children < 12 years old) due to increased risk of Reye's syndrome, which is a type of hepatic encephalopathy. Option: D- Given repeatedly during pregnancy it may be responsible for low birth weight babies. Delayed or prolonged labour, greater postpartum blood loss and premature closure of ductus arteriosus are possible if aspirin is taken at or near term.

Table:

Antirheumatic Drugs and Drugs for Gout

questions.text: A patient who is on aspirin drug for some condition presented to your clinic. Among the following effects, aspirin intake can cause an increase in which effect?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Bleeding time Bleeding time is a medical test done on someone to assess their platelet function. It involves making a patient bleed, then timing how long it takes for them to stop bleeding using a stopwatch or other suitable devices Uses of Aspirin As analgesic (300 to 600 mg during 6 to 8 h) for headache, backache, pulled muscle, toothache, neuralgias. As antipyretic in fever of any origin in the same doses as for analglesia. However, paracetamol and metamizole are safer, and generally preferred. Acute rheumatic fever. Aspirin is the first drug of choice. Other drugs substitute Aspirin only when it fails or in severe cases. Antirheumatic doses are 75 to 100 mg/kg/24 h (resp. 4-6 g daily) in the first weeks. Rheumatoid arthritis. Aspirin a dose of 3 to 5 g/24 h after meal is effective in most cases. Since large doses of Aspirin are poorly tolerated for a long time, the new NSAIDs (diclofenac, ibuprofen, etc.) in depot form are preferred.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: B- Anticoagulant drugs prolong the CT. Option: C- Drugs interfering with intrinsic pathways (like heparin) prolong the aPTT. Option: D- Drugs interfering with extrinsic pathways (like warfarin) prolong the PT. Thrombin time is prolonged in cases of afibrinogenemia and dysfibrinogenemia. Adverse effects of aspirin: Side effects that occur at an analgesic dose (0.5–2.0 g/day) are nausea, vomiting, epigastric distress, and increased occult blood loss in stools. The most important adverse effect of aspirin is gastric mucosal damage and peptic ulceration. Hypersensitivity and idiosyncrasy Though infrequent, these can be serious. Reactions include rashes, fixed drug eruption, urticaria, rhinorrhoea, angioedema, asthma and anaphylactoid reaction. Profuse gastric bleeding occurs in rare instances Anti-inflammatory doses (3–5 g/day) It produces the syndrome called ‘salicylism’—dizziness, tinnitus, vertigo, reversible impairment of hearing and vision, excitement, hyperventilation and electrolyte imbalance

Table:

Aspirin Platelet aggregation inhibitor, anti-inflammatory agent. Prevents platelets from clumping together, or aggregating, and forming emboli. Indications New onset chest pain suggestive of AMI or ACS. Contraindications Hypersensitivity. Relatively contraindicated in patients with active ulcer disease or active asthma.* Adverse reactions/side effects Bronchospasm, anaphylaxis, wheezing in allergic patients, prolonged bleeding, GI bleeding, epigastric distress, nausea, vomiting, heartburn.
